channel.title: BBC News - UK

item.title: UK set for 12 December general election after MPs' vote
item.description: MPs give the green light for a pre-Christmas poll after months of deadlock over Brexit.

item.title: Grenfell Tower fire: 'Systemic failures' in fire brigade's response
item.description: A fire brigade's response to the deadly blaze in a west London tower block is condemned in a report.

item.title: Queensland shark attack: Two British men injured at tourist spot
item.description: The tourists from Southampton and Plymouth suffer serious leg and foot wounds in the attack.

item.title: Essex lorry deaths: Brothers wanted on suspicion of manslaughter
item.description: Christopher and Ronan Hughes are wanted on suspicion of manslaughter and human trafficking.

item.title: Missing Amelia Bambridge: Cambodian police quiz six men
item.description: Amelia Bambridge's father, who has travelled to Cambodia, says he fears she has been abducted.

item.title: Ana Kriégel murder: Family 'broken' without her
item.description: Two teenage boys are to be sentenced for the murder of 14-year-old Ana Kriégel in Dublin.

item.title: British soldiers charged with disgraceful conduct over alleged sex assault
item.description: Four men have been charged on suspicion of sexual assaulting a female soldier.

item.title: The Great British Bake Off crowns its 2019 winner
item.description: After 10 gruelling weeks in the tent, Alice, Steph and David discover which of them has won.

item.title: Female MPs write letter 'in solidarity' with Meghan amid media scrutiny
item.description: The 72 politicians criticise the tone of recent stories about the duchess as "outdated" and "colonial".

item.title: Car stopped by armed police hits officer in Tottenham
item.description: The vehicle was driven away from the scene in north London "at speed", the Met says.

item.title: B-52 bomber plane part lands in Warwickshire garden
item.description: The B-52 bomber was on a routine training mission when the wing-tip gear door fell from the plane.

item.title: Currys PC World customers scammed via eBay
item.description: Criminals siphoned money from unwitting eBay customers who paid using PayPal.

item.title: Brexit: Where do the parties stand?
item.description: The government's Brexit legislation is officially in "limbo", but where do the parties stand?

item.title: Poll tracker: How popular are the Westminster political parties?
item.description: Our poll tracker measures how people say they are going to vote at the next general election.

item.title: Sir John Curtice: Do voters really want another general election?
item.description: MPs are deciding whether the UK should have a third election in just four years.

item.title: Heidi Allen to stand down as South Cambridgeshire MP
item.description: Liberal Democrat says she is "heartbroken" but blames "intimidation and nastiness" for her decision.

item.title: December election: What difference does winter make?
item.description: Election organisers may need to find temporary lighting for polling station entrances and gritters.

item.title: Ed Sheeran named richest UK celebrity aged 30 or under
item.description: Ed Sheeran, Emma Watson and Cara Delevingne are among the 10 biggest-earning young UK celebrities.

item.title: Brexit: Five things the government has stopped
item.description: The granting of a further Brexit extension changes Whitehall plans for the UK's EU exit.

item.title: 'We're not moving' - when reserving a train seat goes wrong
item.description: The current system rewards 'being a jerk', says a pregnant woman who recently had her seat taken.

item.title: Sperm donors should waive anonymity, fertility regulator says
item.description: A man who has fathered up to 110 children says it is impossible for sperm donors to be anonymous.

item.title: The challenge of being disabled and green
item.description: A disabled green enthusiast shares how she builds eco-friendliness into her life even though it is often a less accessible option for her.

item.title: Council tenant: 'Cockroaches bit my baby's face'
item.description: Residents in a 1960s block surrounded by redevelopment say they are "being left to rot" by Barnet Council.

item.title: How I beat drugs, violence and life in a Glasgow gang
item.description: Action for Children are rolling out a project across the UK to divert young men from organised crime.

item.title: Why passwords don't work, and what will replace them
item.description: Passwords can be insecure, easy to lose and easier to forget, so can new tech protect us?

item.title: PM on election: 'Only one way' to move UK forward
item.description: The prime minister has told the Commons that the UK must have a general election "to move this country forward".

item.title: Jeremy Corbyn: 'We are ready for an election'
item.description: Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn has said his party is ready for a general election with a "strong message on how we transform our society".

item.title: Grenfell Tower inquiry: ‘The boxing gym was our home’
item.description: As part one of the inquiry into Grenfell Tower is published, boxers who trained there have their say.

item.title: Cockroaches, mould and drugs on London estate
item.description: Residents in a 1960s block surrounded by redevelopment say they are "being left to rot" by Barnet Council.

item.title: Cwmbran's new hospital: A look behind the scenes
item.description: The Grange University Hospital is the biggest single investment in the history of the Welsh NHS.

item.title: Black History Month: 'I had to defend myself against racists'
item.description: Dudley Simms became a karate world champion at 64 after taking the sport up to defend himself.

item.title: Louise Harvey inquest: Breast op death woman 'given medication late'
item.description: Louise Harvey was given blood thinners eight hours later than she should have been, an inquest hears.

item.title: Election: Nicola Sturgeon 'ready' to take on Tories in December
item.description: The election bill has still to go through Lords but FM is expected to hit the campaign trail soon.

item.title: Northern Ireland parties react to December election vote
item.description: MPs voted by a margin of 438 votes to 20 in favour of holding an election on 12 December.

item.title: General election: Welsh Labour MPs split on 12 December poll vote
item.description: The UK looks set for a snap poll - but Welsh Labour MPs were split on whether it should happen.

item.title: Handcuffed man died in Southampton river escaping police
item.description: Reece Hillier was found in the water two months after his attempted arrest for drug possession.
